Sentencas: A simplified anodic solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) system, Ni, H-2-H2O\YSZ, is investigated using the so-called state-space modeling (SSM) approach that combines experiments, modeling, and simulations.
Titulo: State-space modeling of the anodic SOFC system Ni, H2-H2O|YSZ

Sentencas: The approach is first described in general.
Titulo: State-space modeling of the anodic SOFC system Ni, H2-H2O|YSZ

Sentencas: Then, an electrochemical model is established for the Ni, H-2-H2O\YSZ system.
Titulo: State-space modeling of the anodic SOFC system Ni, H2-H2O|YSZ

Sentencas: The kinetic constants necessary for the simulations are estimated on the basis of literature data.
Titulo: State-space modeling of the anodic SOFC system Ni, H2-H2O|YSZ

Sentencas: The model is validated by fitting the simulated to the experimental impedance spectra, which were measured under well-defined operating conditions, simulated directly from the assumed electrochemical model and the estimated kinetic constants.
Titulo: State-space modeling of the anodic SOFC system Ni, H2-H2O|YSZ

Sentencas: Simulations were also carried out varying the triple phase boundary (TPB) length, the partial pressure of hydrogen and of water, and the overpotential.
Titulo: State-space modeling of the anodic SOFC system Ni, H2-H2O|YSZ

Sentencas: A comparison of the simulated with the experimental data proves the feasibility of the approach for investigating the electrochemistry of SOFC anodes.
Titulo: State-space modeling of the anodic SOFC system Ni, H2-H2O|YSZ

Sentencas: However, it comes out that the assumed model requires modifications.
Titulo: State-space modeling of the anodic SOFC system Ni, H2-H2O|YSZ

Sentencas: An alternative model is proposed for further investigations.
Titulo: State-space modeling of the anodic SOFC system Ni, H2-H2O|YSZ
